resources.string: Solar Conduction Dryer is a solar powered food dehydrator. It reduces moisture content in agro and marine produces so that their shelf-life could be increased up-to 1year.

•Fresh products ( fruits, vegetables, ﬁshes etc. ) have moisture contents of about 70–95%. At these values, the product is subject to deteriorate very quickly as microorganisms are very active. Solar Conduction Dryer can remove moisture content to about 5–15%. 
•At these levels, depending on the type of the product-the products are free from microorganism reactions or activities. 
•Food dehydration together with food preservation aims to prolong the shelf life of agricultural products, control the seasonal variation of food supply, stabilise the marketing of agricultural products and improve the food quality.

•SCD should be installed at a clean , hygienic and dust free place. 
•Where ever possible, concrete ﬂooring is recommended, to prevent the contamination by dust etc. 
•Installation place should get the sunlight through out the day i.e. should be shadow-free, to maximize the utilization of solar thermal energy. 
•SCD should be placed in such a way that its chimney (central hood) is parallel to the East-West direction. In other words, trays should be operated in North-South direction.

The following factors should be observed when processing food using Solar ConductionDryer technology: 
•The processor (personnel)cleanliness 
•The processing place (room) cleanliness 
•The equipment and tools cleanliness 
•General processing cleanliness 
While preparing material to be dried, one must consider: 
•Selection of quality fruits/ vegetables/ﬁshes 
•Washing 
•Peeling 
•Cutting or slicing into small pieces

•Trays should be cleaned with soft cloth and mild dish-washing liquid before use. Excess water/ juice should be drained off from the sliced material before loading. 
•70-80% of the area on the trays should be evenly covered with the single layer of material to be dried.20-30% of the black surface should be evenly exposed to solar radiations, it will act as a heat-absorber. 
•It is recommended to load dryers in the morning as early as possible. It is also recommended to unload dryers when the product is dried. 
•In case the material is very sticky, it should be turned up side down, intermediately, to avoid sticking to the trays. 
•In last stage of drying, material should be inspected to prevent over-drying.

The drying time is very subjective entity and it depends on variety of factors such as: 
• Slices/ cuts and layer Depth of the Drying Material 
•Solar Radiation Intensity 
•Ambient Temperature 
•Relative Humidity
